   21: -module(ftp_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: 
   26: %% Note: This directive should only be used in test suites.
   27: -compile(export_all).
   28: 
   29: -define(FTP_USER, "anonymous").
   30: -define(FTP_PASS(Cmnt), (fun({ok,__H}) -> "ftp_SUITE_"++Cmnt++"@" ++ __H;
   31:                             (_) -> "ftp_SUITE_"++Cmnt++"@localhost"
   32:                          end)(inet:gethostname())
   33:        ).
   34: 
   35: -define(BAD_USER, "baduser").
   36: -define(BAD_DIR,  "baddirectory").
   37: 
   38: -record(progress, {
   39:           current = 0,
   40:           total
   41:          }).
   42: 
   43: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   44: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
   45: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   46: suite() ->
   47:     [{timetrap,{seconds,20}}].
   48: 
   49: all() ->
   50:     [
   51:      {group, ftp_passive},
   52:      {group, ftp_active},
   53:      {group, ftpes_passive},
   54:      {group, ftpes_active},
   55:      {group, ftps_passive},
   56:      {group, ftps_active},
   57:      {group, ftpes_passive_reuse},
   58:      {group, ftpes_active_reuse},
   59:      {group, ftps_passive_reuse},
   60:      {group, ftps_active_reuse},
   61:      {group, ftp_sup},
   62:      app,
   63:      appup,
   64:      error_ehost,
   65:      error_datafail,
   66:      clean_shutdown
   67:     ].
   68: 
   69: groups() ->
   70:     [
   71:      {ftp_passive, [], ftp_tests()},
   72:      {ftp_active, [], ftp_tests()},
   73:      {ftpes_passive, [], ftp_tests_smoke()},
   74:      {ftpes_active, [], ftp_tests_smoke()},
   75:      {ftps_passive, [], ftp_tests_smoke()},
   76:      {ftps_active, [], ftp_tests_smoke()},
   77:      {ftpes_passive_reuse, [], ftp_tests_smoke()},
   78:      {ftpes_active_reuse, [], ftp_tests_smoke()},
   79:      {ftps_passive_reuse, [], ftp_tests_smoke()},
   80:      {ftps_active_reuse, [], ftp_tests_smoke()},
   81:      {ftp_sup, [], ftp_sup_tests()}
   82:     ].
   83: 
   84: ftp_tests()->
   85:     [
   86:      user,
   87:      bad_user,
   88:      pwd,
   89:      cd,
   90:      lcd,
   91:      ls,
   92:      nlist,
   93:      rename,
   94:      delete,
   95:      mkdir,
   96:      rmdir,
   97:      send,
   98:      send_3,
   99:      send_bin,
  100:      send_chunk,
  101:      append,
  102:      append_bin,
  103:      append_chunk,
  104:      recv,
  105:      recv_3,
  106:      recv_bin,
  107:      recv_bin_twice,
  108:      recv_chunk,
  109:      recv_chunk_twice,
  110:      recv_chunk_three_times,
  111:      recv_chunk_delay,
  112:      type,
  113:      quote,
  114:      error_elogin,
  115:      progress_report_send,
  116:      progress_report_recv,
  117:      not_owner,
  118:      unexpected_call,
  119:      unexpected_cast,
  120:      unexpected_bang
  121:     ].
  122: 
  123: ftp_tests_smoke() ->
  124:     [
  125:      ls
  126:     ].
  127: 
  128: ftp_sup_tests() ->
  129:     [
  130:      ftp_worker
  131:     ].
  132: 
  133: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  134: 
  135: %%% Config
  136: %%% key                        meaning
  137: %%% ................................................................
  138: %%% ftpservers                list of servers to check if they are available
  139: %%%                        The element is:
  140: %%%                          {Name, % string(). The os command name
  141: %%%                        Path, % string(). The os PATH syntax, e.g "/bin:/usr/bin"
  142: %%%                           StartCommand, % fun()->{ok,start_result()} | {error,string()}.
  143: %%% % The command to start the daemon with.
  144: %%%                           ChkUp, % fun(start_result()) -> string(). Os command to check
  145: %%% %       if the server is running. [] if not running.
  146: %%% %       The string in string() is suitable for logging.
  147: %%%                           StopCommand, % fun(start_result()) -> void(). The command to stop the daemon with.
  148: %%%                           AugmentFun, % fun(config()) -> config() Adds two funs for transforming names of files
  149: %%% %       and directories to the form they are returned from this server
  150: %%%                           ServerHost, % string(). Mostly "localhost"
  151: %%%                           ServerPort % pos_integer()
  152: %%%                          }
  153: %%%
  154: 
  155: -define(default_ftp_servers,
  156:         [{"vsftpd",
  157:           "/sbin:/usr/sbin:/usr/local/sbin",
  158:           fun(__CONF__, AbsName) ->
  159:                   DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,__CONF__),
  160:                   ConfFile = filename:join(DataDir, "vsftpd.conf"),
  161:                   PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,__CONF__),
  162:                   AnonRoot = PrivDir,
  163:                   Cmd0 = AbsName,
  164:                   Args0 = [filename:join(DataDir,"vsftpd.conf"),
  165:                            "-oftpd_banner=erlang_otp_testing",
  166:                            "-oanon_root=\"" ++ AnonRoot ++ "\""
  167:                           ],
  168:                   Args1 = lists:append(Args0, case proplists:get_value(name, proplists:get_value(tc_group_properties,__CONF__,[])) of
  169:                       ftp_active -> ["-opasv_enable=NO"];
  170:                       ftp_passive -> ["-oport_enable=NO"];
  171:                       _ -> []
  172:                   end),
  173:                   Args = case proplists:get_value(ftpd_ssl,__CONF__) of
  174:                       true ->
  175:                           A0 = [
  176:                                 "-ossl_enable=YES",
  177:                                 "-orsa_cert_file=\"" ++ filename:join(DataDir,"server-cert.pem") ++ "\"",
  178:                                 "-orsa_private_key_file=\"" ++ filename:join(DataDir,"server-key.pem") ++ "\"",
  179:                                 "-oforce_anon_logins_ssl=YES",
  180:                                 "-oforce_anon_data_ssl=YES"
  181:                                ],
  182:                           A1 = case proplists:get_value(ftpd_ssl_reuse,__CONF__) of
  183:                               true -> ["-orequire_ssl_reuse=YES"];
  184:                               _ -> []
  185:                           end,
  186:                           A2 = case proplists:get_value(ftpd_ssl_implicit,__CONF__) of
  187:                               true -> ["-oimplicit_ssl=YES"];
  188:                               _ -> []
  189:                           end,
  190:                           lists:append([Args1, A0, A1, A2]);
  191:                       _ ->
  192:                           Args1
  193:                   end,
  194:                   % eof on stdin does not kill vsftpd
  195:                   Cmd = "script -qefc '" ++ "stty -echo intr ^D && exec " ++ string:join([Cmd0|Args], " ") ++ "' /dev/null",
  196:                   Parent = self(),
  197:                   Helper = spawn(fun() ->
  198:                       case os:cmd("ps ax | grep erlang_otp_testing | awk '/vsftpd/{print $1}'") of
  199:                           [] ->
  200:                               % OpenSSL system_default_sect CipherString may reject the SHA1 signed testing certificates
  201:                               case open_port({spawn,Cmd},[{env,[{"OPENSSL_CONF","/dev/null"}]},exit_status]) of
  202:                                   Port when is_port(Port) ->
  203:                                       timer:sleep(500),        % give it a chance to actually open the listening socket
  204:                                       Parent ! {ok,Port},
  205:                                       receive {From,close} ->
  206:                                           true = erlang:port_command(Port, [4]),
  207:                                           receive {Port,{exit_status,Status}} ->
  208:                                               ct:log("vsftpd exit with status ~b", [Status - 128])
  209:                                           after 500 ->
  210:                                               ct:log("vsftpd requires violence", []),
  211:                                               os:cmd("kill -9 `ps ax | grep erlang_otp_testing | awk '/vsftpd/{print $1}'`")
  212:                                           end,
  213:                                           From ! ok
  214:                                       end;
  215:                                   _Else ->
  216:                                       Parent ! {error,open_port}
  217:                               end;
  218:                           OSPids ->
  219:                               Parent ! {error,{existing,OSPids}}
  220:                       end
  221:                   end),
  222:                   receive
  223:                       {ok,Port} ->
  224:                           ct:log("Config file:~n~s~n~nServer start command:~n  ~s~nResult:~n  ~p",
  225:                                   [case file:read_file(ConfFile) of
  226:                                       {ok,X} -> X;
  227:                                       _ -> ""
  228:                                   end,
  229:                                   Cmd, erlang:port_info(Port)
  230:                           ]),
  231:                           {ok, {Helper, Port}};
  232:                       {error,_} = Error ->
  233:                           ct:fail("open_port: ~p", [Error]),
  234:                           Error
  235:                   end
  236:           end,
  237:           fun(_StartResult = {_Helper, Port}) -> erlang:port_info(Port)
  238:           end,
  239:           fun(_StartResult = {Helper, _Port}) -> Helper ! {self(), close}, receive ok -> ok end
  240:           end,
  241:           fun(__CONF__) ->
  242:                   AnonRoot = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,__CONF__),
  243:                   [{id2ftp, fun(Id) -> filename:join(AnonRoot,Id) end},
  244:                    {id2ftp_result,fun(Id) -> filename:join(AnonRoot,Id) end} | __CONF__]
  245:           end,
  246:           "localhost",
  247:           9999
  248:          }
  249:         ]
  250:        ).
  251: 
  252: 
  253: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  254:     % remove anything defunct from previoused crashed runs
  255:     os:cmd("kill -9 `ps ax | grep erlang_otp_testing | awk '/vsftpd/{print $1}'`"),
  256: 
  257:     case find_executable(Config) of
  258:         false ->
  259:             {skip, "No ftp server found"};
  260:         {ok,Data} ->
  261:             TstDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config), "test"),
  262:             file:make_dir(TstDir),
  263:             ftp_test_lib:make_cert_files(proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config)),
  264:             [{test_dir,TstDir},{ftpd_data,Data} | Config]
  265:     end.
  266: 
  267: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  268:     ok.
  269: 
  270: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  271: init_per_group(Group, Config) when Group == ftpes_passive;
  272:                                    Group == ftpes_active;
  273:                                    Group == ftps_passive;
  274:                                    Group == ftps_active;
  275:                                    Group == ftpes_passive_reuse;
  276:                                    Group == ftpes_active_reuse;
  277:                                    Group == ftps_passive_reuse;
  278:                                    Group == ftps_active_reuse ->
  279:     catch application:stop(crypto),
  280:     try application:start(crypto) of
  281:         ok when Group == ftpes_passive; Group == ftpes_active ->
  282:             start_ftpd([{ftpd_ssl,true}|Config]);
  283:         ok when Group == ftps_passive; Group == ftps_active ->
  284:             start_ftpd([{ftpd_ssl,true},{ftpd_ssl_implicit,true}|Config]);
  285:         ok when Group == ftpes_passive_reuse; Group == ftpes_active_reuse ->
  286:             start_ftpd([{ftpd_ssl,true},{ftpd_ssl_reuse,true}|Config]);
  287:         ok when Group == ftps_passive_reuse; Group == ftps_active_reuse ->
  288:             start_ftpd([{ftpd_ssl,true},{ftpd_ssl_reuse,true},{ftpd_ssl_implicit,true}|Config])
  289:     catch
  290:         _:_ ->
  291:             {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
  292:     end;
  293: 
  294: init_per_group(_Group, Config) ->
  295:     start_ftpd(Config).
  296: 
  297: end_per_group(_Group, Config) ->
  298:     stop_ftpd(Config),
  299:     Config.
  300: 
  301: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  302: init_per_testcase(T, Config0) when T =:= app; T =:= appup ->
  303:     Config0;
  304: init_per_testcase(Case, Config0) ->
  305:     application:ensure_started(ftp),
  306:     case Case of
  307:         error_datafail ->
  308:             catch application:stop(crypto),
  309:             try application:start(crypto) of
  310:                 ok ->
  311:                     Config = start_ftpd([{ftpd_ssl,true},{ftpd_ssl_reuse,true}|Config0]),
  312:                     init_per_testcase2(Case, Config)
  313:             catch
  314:                 _:_ ->
  315:                     {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
  316:             end;
  317:         clean_shutdown ->
  318:             Config = start_ftpd(Config0),
  319:             init_per_testcase2(Case, Config);
  320:         _ ->
  321:             init_per_testcase2(Case, Config0)
  322:     end.
  323: 
  324: init_per_testcase2(Case, Config0) ->
  325:     Group = proplists:get_value(name, proplists:get_value(tc_group_properties,Config0)),
  326: 
  327:     TLSB = vsftpd_tls(),
  328:     TLS = [{tls,TLSB}],
  329:     SSL = [{tls_sec_method,ftps}|TLS],
  330:     TLSReuse = [{tls_ctrl_session_reuse,true}|TLS],
  331:     SSLReuse = [{tls_sec_method,ftps}|TLSReuse],
  332:     ACTIVE = [{mode,active}],
  333:     PASSIVE = [{mode,passive}],
  334:     CaseOpts = case Case of
  335:                    progress_report_send -> [{progress, {?MODULE,progress,#progress{}}}];
  336:                    progress_report_recv -> [{progress, {?MODULE,progress,#progress{}}}];
  337:                    _ -> []
  338:                end,
  339:     ExtraOpts = [{verbose,true} | CaseOpts],
  340:     Config =
  341:         case Group of
  342:             ftp_active          -> ftp__open(Config0,              ACTIVE ++ ExtraOpts);
  343:             ftpes_active        -> ftp__open(Config0, TLS      ++  ACTIVE ++ ExtraOpts);
  344:             ftps_active         -> ftp__open(Config0, SSL      ++  ACTIVE ++ ExtraOpts);
  345:             ftp_passive         -> ftp__open(Config0,             PASSIVE ++ ExtraOpts);
  346:             ftpes_passive       -> ftp__open(Config0, TLS      ++ PASSIVE ++ ExtraOpts);
  347:             ftps_passive        -> ftp__open(Config0, SSL      ++ PASSIVE ++ ExtraOpts);
  348:             ftpes_passive_reuse -> ftp__open(Config0, TLSReuse ++ PASSIVE ++ ExtraOpts);
  349:             ftpes_active_reuse  -> ftp__open(Config0, TLSReuse ++  ACTIVE ++ ExtraOpts);
  350:             ftps_passive_reuse  -> ftp__open(Config0, SSLReuse ++ PASSIVE ++ ExtraOpts);
  351:             ftps_active_reuse   -> ftp__open(Config0, SSLReuse ++  ACTIVE ++ ExtraOpts);
  352:             ftp_sup             -> ftp__open(Config0, ACTIVE ++ ExtraOpts);
  353:             undefined           -> Config0
  354:         end,
  355:     case Case of
  356:         user           -> Config;
  357:         bad_user       -> Config;
  358:         error_elogin   -> Config;
  359:         error_ehost    -> Config;
  360:         clean_shutdown -> Config;
  361:         _ ->
  362:             ConfigN = if
  363:                 Case == error_datafail ->
  364:                     ftp__open(Config, TLS++PASSIVE++ExtraOpts);
  365:                 true ->
  366:                     Config
  367:             end,
  368:             Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp,ConfigN),
  369:             ok = ftp:user(Pid, ?FTP_USER, ?FTP_PASS(atom_to_list(Group)++"-"++atom_to_list(Case)) ),
  370:             ok = ftp:cd(Pid, proplists:get_value(priv_dir,ConfigN)),
  371:             ConfigN
  372:     end.
  373: 
  374: end_per_testcase(T, _Config) when T =:= app; T =:= appup -> ok;
  375: end_per_testcase(user, _Config) -> ok;
  376: end_per_testcase(bad_user, _Config) -> ok;
  377: end_per_testcase(error_elogin, _Config) -> ok;
  378: end_per_testcase(error_ehost, _Config) -> ok;
  379: end_per_testcase(T, Config) when T =:= error_datafail; T =:= clean_shutdown ->
  380:     T == error_datafail andalso ftp__close(Config),
  381:     stop_ftpd(Config),
  382:     ok;
  383: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  384:     case proplists:get_value(tc_status,Config) of
  385:         ok -> ok;
  386:         _ ->
  387:             try ftp:latest_ctrl_response(proplists:get_value(ftp,Config))
  388:             of
  389:                 {ok,S} -> ct:log("***~n*** Latest ctrl channel response:~n***     ~p~n***",[S])
  390:             catch
  391:                 _:_ -> ok
  392:             end
  393:     end,
  394:     Group = proplists:get_value(name, proplists:get_value(tc_group_properties,Config)),
  395:     case Group of
  396:         ftp_sup ->
  397:             ftp_stop_service(Config);
  398:         _Else ->
  399:             ftp__close(Config)
  400:     end.
  401: 
  402: vsftpd_tls() ->
  403:     %% Workaround for interoperability issues with vsftpd =< 3.0.2:
  404:     %%
  405:     %% vsftpd =< 3.0.2 does not support ECDHE ciphers and the ssl application
  406:     %% removed ciphers with RSA key exchange from its default cipher list.
  407:     %% To allow interoperability with old versions of vsftpd, cipher suites
  408:     %% with RSA key exchange are appended to the default cipher list.
  409:     All = ssl:cipher_suites(all, 'tlsv1.2'),
  410:     Default = ssl:cipher_suites(default, 'tlsv1.2'),
  411:     RSASuites =
  412:         ssl:filter_cipher_suites(All, [{key_exchange, fun(rsa) -> true;
  413:                                                          (_) -> false end}]),
  414:     Suites = ssl:append_cipher_suites(RSASuites, Default),
  415:     [
  416:         {ciphers,Suites},
  417:         %% vsftpd =< 3.0.3 gets upset with anything later than tlsv1.2
  418:         {versions,['tlsv1.2']}
  419:     ].
  420: 
  421: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  422: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  423: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  424: app() ->
  425:     [{doc, "Test that the ftp app file is ok"}].
  426: app(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  427:     ok = test_server:app_test(ftp).
  428: 
  429: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  430: appup() ->
  431:     [{doc, "Test that the ftp appup file is ok"}].
  432: appup(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  433:     ok = test_server:appup_test(ftp).
  434: 
  435: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  436: 
  437: user() -> [
  438:            {doc, "Open an ftp connection to a host, and logon as anonymous ftp,"
  439:             " then logoff"}].
  440: user(Config) ->
  441:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  442:     ok = ftp:user(Pid, ?FTP_USER, ?FTP_PASS("")),% logon
  443:     ok = ftp:close(Pid),                        % logoff
  444:     {error,eclosed} = ftp:pwd(Pid),                % check logoff result
  445:     ok.
  446: 
  447: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  448: bad_user() ->
  449:     [{doc, "Open an ftp connection to a host, and logon with bad user."}].
  450: bad_user(Config) ->
  451:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  452:     {error, euser} = ftp:user(Pid, ?BAD_USER, ?FTP_PASS("")),
  453:     ok.
  454: 
  455: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  456: pwd() ->
  457:     [{doc, "Test ftp:pwd/1 & ftp:lpwd/1"}].
  458: pwd(Config0) ->
  459:     Config = set_state([reset], Config0),
  460:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  461:     {ok, PWD} = ftp:pwd(Pid),
  462:     {ok, PathLpwd} = ftp:lpwd(Pid),
  463:     PWD = id2ftp_result("", Config),
  464:     PathLpwd = id2ftp_result("", Config).
  465: 
  466: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  467: cd() ->
  468:     ["Open an ftp connection, log on as anonymous ftp, and cd to a"
  469:      "directory and to a non-existent directory."].
  470: cd(Config0) ->
  471:     Dir = "test",
  472:     Config = set_state([reset,{mkdir,Dir}], Config0),
  473:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  474:     ok = ftp:cd(Pid, id2ftp(Dir,Config)),
  475:     {ok, PWD} = ftp:pwd(Pid),
  476:     ExpectedPWD = id2ftp_result(Dir, Config),
  477:     PWD = ExpectedPWD,
  478:     {error, epath} = ftp:cd(Pid, ?BAD_DIR),
  479:     ok.
  480: 
  481: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  482: lcd() ->
  483:     [{doc, "Test api function ftp:lcd/2"}].
  484: lcd(Config0) ->
  485:     Dir = "test",
  486:     Config = set_state([reset,{mkdir,Dir}], Config0),
  487:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  488:     ok = ftp:lcd(Pid, id2ftp(Dir,Config)),
  489:     {ok, PWD} = ftp:lpwd(Pid),
  490:     ExpectedPWD = id2ftp_result(Dir, Config),
  491:     PWD = ExpectedPWD,
  492:     {error, epath} = ftp:lcd(Pid, ?BAD_DIR).
  493: 
  494: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  495: ls() ->
  496:     [{doc, "Open an ftp connection; ls the current directory, and the "
  497:       "\"test\" directory. We assume that ls never fails, since "
  498:       "it's output is meant to be read by humans. "}].
  499: ls(Config0) ->
  500:     TestFileName = "testing-file",
  501:     Config = set_state([reset,{mkdir,"test"},{mkfile, TestFileName, TestFileName}], Config0),
  502:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  503:     {ok, _R1} = ftp:ls(Pid),
  504:     {ok, _R2} = ftp:ls(Pid, id2ftp("test",Config)),
  505:     {ok, _R3} = ftp:nlist(Pid, id2ftp(TestFileName, Config)),
  506:     {ok, []} = ftp:nlist(Pid, id2ftp("non-existing-folder",Config)),
  507:     {ok, []} = ftp:nlist(Pid, id2ftp("test/non-existing-file",Config)),
  508:     %% neither nlist nor ls operates on a directory
  509:     %% they operate on a pathname, which *can* be a
  510:     %% directory, but can also be a filename or a group
  511:     %% of files (including wildcards).
  512:     case proplists:get_value(wildcard_support, Config) of
  513:         true ->
  514:             {ok, _R4} = ftp:ls(Pid, id2ftp("te*",Config));
  515:         _ ->
  516:             ok
  517:     end.
  518: 
  519: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  520: nlist() ->
  521:     [{doc,"Open an ftp connection; nlist the current directory, and the "
  522:                "\"test\" directory. Nlist does not behave consistently over "
  523:                "operating systems. On some it is an error to have an empty "
  524:                "directory."}].
  525: nlist(Config0) ->
  526:     TestFileName = "testing-file",
  527:     Config = set_state([reset,{mkdir,"test"},{mkfile, TestFileName, TestFileName}], Config0),
  528:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  529:     {ok, _R1} = ftp:nlist(Pid),
  530:     {ok, _R2} = ftp:nlist(Pid, id2ftp("test",Config)),
  531:     {ok, _R3} = ftp:nlist(Pid, id2ftp(TestFileName, Config)),
  532:     {ok, []} = ftp:nlist(Pid, id2ftp("non-existing-folder",Config)),
  533:     {ok, []} = ftp:nlist(Pid, id2ftp("test/non-existing-file",Config)),
  534:     %% neither nlist nor ls operates on a directory
  535:     %% they operate on a pathname, which *can* be a
  536:     %% directory, but can also be a filename or a group
  537:     %% of files (including wildcards).
  538:     case proplists:get_value(wildcard_support, Config) of
  539:         true ->
  540:             {ok, _R4} = ftp:nlist(Pid, id2ftp("te*",Config));
  541:         _ ->
  542:             ok
  543:     end.
  544: 
  545: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  546: rename() ->
  547:     [{doc, "Rename a file."}].
  548: rename(Config0) ->
  549:     Contents = <<"ftp_SUITE test ...">>,
  550:     OldFile = "old.txt",
  551:     NewFile = "new.txt",
  552:     Config = set_state([reset,{mkfile,OldFile,Contents}], Config0),
  553:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  554: 
  555:     ok = ftp:rename(Pid,
  556:                     id2ftp(OldFile,Config),
  557:                     id2ftp(NewFile,Config)),
  558: 
  559:     true = (chk_file(NewFile,Contents,Config)
  560:             and chk_no_file([OldFile],Config)),
  561:     {error,epath} = ftp:rename(Pid,
  562:                                id2ftp("non_existing_file",Config),
  563:                                id2ftp(NewFile,Config)),
  564:     ok.
  565: 
  566: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  567: send() ->
  568:     [{doc, "Transfer a file with ftp using send/2."}].
  569: send(Config0) ->
  570:     Contents = <<"ftp_SUITE test ...">>,
  571:     SrcDir = "data",
  572:     File = "file.txt",
  573:     Config = set_state([reset,{mkfile,[SrcDir,File],Contents}], Config0),
  574:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  575: 
  576:     chk_no_file([File],Config),
  577:     chk_file([SrcDir,File],Contents,Config),
  578: 
  579:     ok = ftp:lcd(Pid, id2ftp(SrcDir,Config)),
  580:     ok = ftp:cd(Pid, id2ftp("",Config)),
  581:     ok = ftp:send(Pid, File),
  582:     chk_file(File, Contents, Config),
  583: 
  584:     {error,epath} = ftp:send(Pid, "non_existing_file"),
  585:     ok.
  586: 
  587: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  588: send_3() ->
  589:     [{doc, "Transfer a file with ftp using send/3."}].
  590: send_3(Config0) ->
  591:     Contents = <<"ftp_SUITE test ...">>,
  592:     Dir = "incoming",
  593:     File = "file.txt",
  594:     RemoteFile = "remfile.txt",
  595:     Config = set_state([reset,{mkfile,File,Contents},{mkdir,Dir}], Config0),
  596:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  597: 
  598:     ok = ftp:cd(Pid, id2ftp(Dir,Config)),
  599:     ok = ftp:lcd(Pid, id2ftp("",Config)),
  600:     ok = ftp:send(Pid, File, RemoteFile),
  601:     chk_file([Dir,RemoteFile], Contents, Config),
  602: 
  603:     {error,epath} = ftp:send(Pid, "non_existing_file", RemoteFile),
  604:     ok.
  605: 
  606: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  607: send_bin() ->
  608:     [{doc, "Send a binary."}].
  609: send_bin(Config0) ->
  610:     BinContents = <<"ftp_SUITE test ...">>,
  611:     File = "file.txt",
  612:     Config = set_state([reset], Config0),
  613:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  614:     {error, enotbinary} = ftp:send_bin(Pid, "some string", id2ftp(File,Config)),
  615:     ok = ftp:send_bin(Pid, BinContents, id2ftp(File,Config)),
  616:     chk_file(File, BinContents, Config),
  617:     {error, efnamena} = ftp:send_bin(Pid, BinContents, "/nothere/nohere"),
  618:     ok.
  619: 
  620: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  621: send_chunk() ->
  622:     [{doc, "Send a binary using chunks."}].
  623: send_chunk(Config0) ->
  624:     Contents1 = <<"1: ftp_SUITE test ...">>,
  625:     Contents2 = <<"2: ftp_SUITE test ...">>,
  626:     File = "file.txt",
  627:     Config = set_state([reset,{mkdir,"incoming"}], Config0),
  628:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  629: 
  630:     ok = ftp:send_chunk_start(Pid, id2ftp(File,Config)),
  631:     {error, echunk} = ftp:send_chunk_start(Pid, id2ftp(File,Config)),
  632:     {error, echunk} = ftp:cd(Pid, "incoming"),
  633:     {error, enotbinary} = ftp:send_chunk(Pid, "some string"),
  634:     ok = ftp:send_chunk(Pid, Contents1),
  635:     ok = ftp:send_chunk(Pid, Contents2),
  636:     ok = ftp:send_chunk_end(Pid),
  637:     chk_file(File, <<Contents1/binary,Contents2/binary>>, Config),
  638: 
  639:     {error, echunk} = ftp:send_chunk(Pid, Contents1),
  640:     {error, echunk} = ftp:send_chunk_end(Pid),
  641:     {error, efnamena} = ftp:send_chunk_start(Pid, "/"),
  642:     ok.
  643: 
  644: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  645: delete() ->
  646:     [{doc, "Delete a file."}].
  647: delete(Config0) ->
  648:     Contents = <<"ftp_SUITE test ...">>,
  649:     File = "file.txt",
  650:     Config = set_state([reset,{mkfile,File,Contents}], Config0),
  651:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  652:     ok = ftp:delete(Pid, id2ftp(File,Config)),
  653:     chk_no_file([File], Config),
  654:     {error,epath} = ftp:delete(Pid, id2ftp(File,Config)),
  655:     ok.
  656: 
  657: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  658: mkdir() ->
  659:     [{doc, "Make a remote directory."}].
  660: mkdir(Config0) ->
  661:     NewDir = "new_dir",
  662:     Config = set_state([reset], Config0),
  663:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  664:     ok = ftp:mkdir(Pid, id2ftp(NewDir,Config)),
  665:     chk_dir([NewDir], Config),
  666:     {error,epath} = ftp:mkdir(Pid, id2ftp(NewDir,Config)),
  667:     ok.
  668: 
  669: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  670: rmdir() ->
  671:     [{doc, "Remove a directory."}].
  672: rmdir(Config0) ->
  673:     Dir = "dir",
  674:     Config = set_state([reset,{mkdir,Dir}], Config0),
  675:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  676:     ok = ftp:rmdir(Pid, id2ftp(Dir,Config)),
  677:     chk_no_dir([Dir], Config),
  678:     {error,epath} = ftp:rmdir(Pid, id2ftp(Dir,Config)),
  679:     ok.
  680: 
  681: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  682: append() ->
  683:     [{doc, "Append a local file twice to a remote file"}].
  684: append(Config0) ->
  685:     SrcFile = "f_src.txt",
  686:     DstFile = "f_dst.txt",
  687:     Contents = <<"ftp_SUITE test ...">>,
  688:     Config = set_state([reset,{mkfile,SrcFile,Contents}], Config0),
  689:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  690:     ok = ftp:append(Pid, id2ftp(SrcFile,Config), id2ftp(DstFile,Config)),
  691:     ok = ftp:append(Pid, id2ftp(SrcFile,Config), id2ftp(DstFile,Config)),
  692:     chk_file(DstFile, <<Contents/binary,Contents/binary>>, Config),
  693:     {error,epath} = ftp:append(Pid, id2ftp("non_existing_file",Config), id2ftp(DstFile,Config)),
  694:     ok.
  695: 
  696: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  697: append_bin() ->
  698:     [{doc, "Append a local file twice to a remote file using append_bin"}].
  699: append_bin(Config0) ->
  700:     DstFile = "f_dst.txt",
  701:     Contents = <<"ftp_SUITE test ...">>,
  702:     Config = set_state([reset], Config0),
  703:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  704:     ok = ftp:append_bin(Pid, Contents, id2ftp(DstFile,Config)),
  705:     ok = ftp:append_bin(Pid, Contents, id2ftp(DstFile,Config)),
  706:     chk_file(DstFile, <<Contents/binary,Contents/binary>>, Config).
  707: 
  708: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  709: append_chunk() ->
  710:     [{doc, "Append chunks."}].
  711: append_chunk(Config0) ->
  712:     File = "f_dst.txt",
  713:     Contents = [<<"ER">>,<<"LE">>,<<"RL">>],
  714:     Config = set_state([reset], Config0),
  715:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  716:     ok = ftp:append_chunk_start(Pid, id2ftp(File,Config)),
  717:     {error, enotbinary} = ftp:append_chunk(Pid, binary_to_list(lists:nth(1,Contents))),
  718:     ok = ftp:append_chunk(Pid,lists:nth(1,Contents)),
  719:     ok = ftp:append_chunk(Pid,lists:nth(2,Contents)),
  720:     ok = ftp:append_chunk(Pid,lists:nth(3,Contents)),
  721:     ok = ftp:append_chunk_end(Pid),
  722:     chk_file(File, <<"ERLERL">>, Config).
  723: 
  724: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  725: recv() ->
  726:     [{doc, "Receive a file using recv/2"}].
  727: recv(Config0) ->
  728:     File1 = "f_dst1.txt",
  729:     File2 = "f_dst2.txt",
  730:     SrcDir = "a_dir",
  731:     Contents1 = <<"1 ftp_SUITE test ...">>,
  732:     Contents2 = <<"2 ftp_SUITE test ...">>,
  733:     Config = set_state([reset, {mkfile,[SrcDir,File1],Contents1}, {mkfile,[SrcDir,File2],Contents2}], Config0),
  734:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  735:     ok = ftp:cd(Pid, id2ftp(SrcDir,Config)),
  736:     ok = ftp:lcd(Pid, id2ftp("",Config)),
  737:     ok = ftp:recv(Pid, File1),
  738:     chk_file(File1, Contents1, Config),
  739:     ok = ftp:recv(Pid, File2),
  740:     chk_file(File2, Contents2, Config),
  741:     {error,epath} = ftp:recv(Pid, "non_existing_file"),
  742:     ok.
  743: 
  744: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  745: recv_3() ->
  746:     [{doc,"Receive a file using recv/3"}].
  747: recv_3(Config0) ->
  748:     DstFile = "f_src.txt",
  749:     SrcFile = "f_dst.txt",
  750:     Contents = <<"ftp_SUITE test ...">>,
  751:     Config = set_state([reset, {mkfile,SrcFile,Contents}], Config0),
  752:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  753:     ok = ftp:cd(Pid, id2ftp("",Config)),
  754:     ok = ftp:recv(Pid, SrcFile, id2abs(DstFile,Config)),
  755:     chk_file(DstFile, Contents, Config).
  756: 
  757: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  758: recv_bin() ->
  759:     [{doc, "Receive a file as a binary."}].
  760: recv_bin(Config0) ->
  761:     File = "f_dst.txt",
  762:     Contents = <<"ftp_SUITE test ...">>,
  763:     Config = set_state([reset, {mkfile,File,Contents}], Config0),
  764:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  765:     {ok,Received} = ftp:recv_bin(Pid, id2ftp(File,Config)),
  766:     find_diff(Received, Contents),
  767:     {error,epath} = ftp:recv_bin(Pid, id2ftp("non_existing_file",Config)),
  768:     ok.
  769: 
  770: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  771: recv_bin_twice() ->
  772:     [{doc, "Receive two files as a binaries."}].
  773: recv_bin_twice(Config0) ->
  774:     File1 = "f_dst1.txt",
  775:     File2 = "f_dst2.txt",
  776:     Contents1 = <<"1 ftp_SUITE test ...">>,
  777:     Contents2 = <<"2 ftp_SUITE test ...">>,
  778:     Config = set_state([reset, {mkfile,File1,Contents1}, {mkfile,File2,Contents2}], Config0),
  779:     ct:log("First transfer",[]),
  780:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  781:     {ok,Received1} = ftp:recv_bin(Pid, id2ftp(File1,Config)),
  782:     find_diff(Received1, Contents1),
  783:     ct:log("Second transfer",[]),
  784:     {ok,Received2} = ftp:recv_bin(Pid, id2ftp(File2,Config)),
  785:     find_diff(Received2, Contents2),
  786:     ct:log("Transfers ready!",[]),
  787:     {error,epath} = ftp:recv_bin(Pid, id2ftp("non_existing_file",Config)),
  788:     ok.
  789: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  790: recv_chunk() ->
  791:     [{doc, "Receive a file using chunk-wise."}].
  792: recv_chunk(Config0) ->
  793:     File = "big_file.txt",
  794:     Contents = list_to_binary( lists:duplicate(1000, lists:seq(0,255)) ),
  795:     Config = set_state([reset, {mkfile,File,Contents}], Config0),
  796:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  797:     {error, "ftp:recv_chunk_start/2 not called"} = do_recv_chunk(Pid),
  798:     ok = ftp:recv_chunk_start(Pid, id2ftp(File,Config)),
  799:     {ok, ReceivedContents} = do_recv_chunk(Pid),
  800:     find_diff(ReceivedContents, Contents).
  801: 
  802: recv_chunk_twice() ->
  803:     [{doc, "Receive two files using chunk-wise."}].
  804: recv_chunk_twice(Config0) ->
  805:     File1 = "big_file1.txt",
  806:     File2 = "big_file2.txt",
  807:     Contents1 = list_to_binary( lists:duplicate(1000, lists:seq(0,255)) ),
  808:     Contents2 = crypto:strong_rand_bytes(1200),
  809:     Config = set_state([reset, {mkfile,File1,Contents1}, {mkfile,File2,Contents2}], Config0),
  810:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  811:     {error, "ftp:recv_chunk_start/2 not called"} = do_recv_chunk(Pid),
  812:     ok = ftp:recv_chunk_start(Pid, id2ftp(File1,Config)),
  813:     {ok, ReceivedContents1} = do_recv_chunk(Pid),
  814:     ok = ftp:recv_chunk_start(Pid, id2ftp(File2,Config)),
  815:     {ok, ReceivedContents2} = do_recv_chunk(Pid),
  816:     find_diff(ReceivedContents1, Contents1),
  817:     find_diff(ReceivedContents2, Contents2).
  818: 
  819: recv_chunk_three_times() ->
  820:     [{doc, "Receive two files using chunk-wise."},
  821:      {timetrap,{seconds,120}}].
  822: recv_chunk_three_times(Config0) ->
  823:     File1 = "big_file1.txt",
  824:     File2 = "big_file2.txt",
  825:     File3 = "big_file3.txt",
  826:     Contents1 = list_to_binary( lists:duplicate(1000, lists:seq(0,255)) ),
  827:     Contents2 = crypto:strong_rand_bytes(1200),
  828:     Contents3 = list_to_binary( lists:duplicate(1000, lists:seq(255,0,-1)) ),
  829: 
  830:     Config = set_state([reset, {mkfile,File1,Contents1}, {mkfile,File2,Contents2}, {mkfile,File3,Contents3}], Config0),
  831:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  832:     {error, "ftp:recv_chunk_start/2 not called"} = do_recv_chunk(Pid),
  833: 
  834:     ok = ftp:recv_chunk_start(Pid, id2ftp(File3,Config)),
  835:     {ok, ReceivedContents3} = do_recv_chunk(Pid),
  836: 
  837:     ok = ftp:recv_chunk_start(Pid, id2ftp(File1,Config)),
  838:     {ok, ReceivedContents1} = do_recv_chunk(Pid),
  839: 
  840:     ok = ftp:recv_chunk_start(Pid, id2ftp(File2,Config)),
  841:     {ok, ReceivedContents2} = do_recv_chunk(Pid),
  842: 
  843:     find_diff(ReceivedContents1, Contents1),
  844:     find_diff(ReceivedContents2, Contents2),
  845:     find_diff(ReceivedContents3, Contents3).
  846: 
  847: 
  848: do_recv_chunk(Pid) ->
  849:     recv_chunk(Pid, <<>>).
  850: recv_chunk(Pid, Acc) ->
  851:     case ftp:recv_chunk(Pid) of
  852:         ok ->
  853:             {ok, Acc};
  854:         {ok, Bin} ->
  855:             recv_chunk(Pid, <<Acc/binary, Bin/binary>>);
  856:         Error ->
  857:             Error
  858:     end.
  859: 
  860: recv_chunk_delay(Config0) when is_list(Config0) ->
  861:     File1 = "big_file1.txt",
  862:     Contents = list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, lists:seq(0,255))),
  863:     Config = set_state([reset, {mkfile,File1,Contents}], Config0),
  864:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  865:     ok = ftp:recv_chunk_start(Pid, id2ftp(File1,Config)),
  866:     {ok, ReceivedContents} = delay_recv_chunk(Pid),
  867:     find_diff(ReceivedContents, Contents).
  868: 
  869: delay_recv_chunk(Pid) ->
  870:      delay_recv_chunk(Pid, <<>>).
  871: delay_recv_chunk(Pid, Acc) ->
  872:     ct:log("Received size ~p", [byte_size(Acc)]),
  873:     case ftp:recv_chunk(Pid) of
  874:          ok ->
  875:              {ok, Acc};
  876:          {ok, Bin} ->
  877:             ct:sleep(100),
  878:             delay_recv_chunk(Pid, <<Acc/binary, Bin/binary>>);
  879:         Error ->
  880:             Error
  881:      end.
  882: 
  883: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  884: type() ->
  885:     [{doc,"Test that we can change between ASCII and binary transfer mode"}].
  886: type(Config) ->
  887:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  888:     ok = ftp:type(Pid, ascii),
  889:     ok = ftp:type(Pid, binary),
  890:     ok = ftp:type(Pid, ascii),
  891:     {error, etype} = ftp:type(Pid, foobar).
  892: 
  893: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  894: quote(Config) ->
  895:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  896:     ["257 \""++_Rest] = ftp:quote(Pid, "pwd"), %% 257
  897:     [_| _] = ftp:quote(Pid, "help"),
  898:     %% This negative test causes some ftp servers to hang. This test
  899:     %% is not important for the client, so we skip it for now.
  900:     %%["425 Can't build data connection: Connection refused."]
  901:     %% = ftp:quote(Pid, "list"),
  902:     ok.
  903: 
  904: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  905: progress_report_send() ->
  906:     [{doc, "Test the option progress for ftp:send/[2,3]"}].
  907: progress_report_send(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  908:     ReportPid =
  909:         spawn_link(?MODULE, progress_report_receiver_init, [self(), 1]),
  910:     send(Config),
  911:     receive
  912:         {ReportPid, ok} ->
  913:             ok
  914:     end.
  915: 
  916: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  917: progress_report_recv() ->
  918:     [{doc, "Test the option progress for ftp:recv/[2,3]"}].
  919: progress_report_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  920:     ReportPid =
  921:          spawn_link(?MODULE, progress_report_receiver_init, [self(), 3]),
  922:     recv(Config),
  923:     receive
  924:          {ReportPid, ok} ->
  925:              ok
  926:     end.
  927: 
  928: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  929: 
  930: not_owner() ->
  931:     [{doc, "Test what happens if a process that not owns the connection tries "
  932:     "to use it"}].
  933: not_owner(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  934:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  935: 
  936:     Parent = self(),
  937:     OtherPid = spawn_link(
  938:                  fun() ->
  939:                          {error, not_connection_owner} = ftp:pwd(Pid),
  940:                          ftp:close(Pid),
  941:                          Parent ! {self(), ok}
  942:                  end),
  943:     receive
  944:         {OtherPid, ok} ->
  945:             {ok, _} = ftp:pwd(Pid)
  946:     end.
  947: 
  948: 
  949: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  950: 
  951: 
  952: unexpected_call()->
  953:     [{doc, "Test that behaviour of the ftp process if the api is abused"}].
  954: unexpected_call(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  955:     Flag =  process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  956:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  957: 
  958:     %% A serious programming fault, the connection will be shut down
  959:     case (catch gen_server:call(Pid, {self(), foobar, 10}, infinity)) of
  960:         {error, {connection_terminated, 'API_violation'}} ->
  961:             ok;
  962:         Unexpected1 ->
  963:             exit({unexpected_result, Unexpected1})
  964:     end,
  965:     ct:sleep(500),
  966:     undefined = process_info(Pid, status),
  967:     process_flag(trap_exit, Flag).
  968: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  969: 
  970: unexpected_cast()->
  971:     [{doc, "Test that behaviour of the ftp process if the api is abused"}].
  972: unexpected_cast(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  973:     Flag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  974:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  975:      %% A serious programming fault, the connection will be shut down
  976:     gen_server:cast(Pid, {self(), foobar, 10}),
  977:     ct:sleep(500),
  978:     undefined = process_info(Pid, status),
  979:     process_flag(trap_exit, Flag).
  980: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  981: 
  982: unexpected_bang()->
  983:     [{doc, "Test that connection ignores unexpected bang"}].
  984: unexpected_bang(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  985:     Flag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  986:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
  987:     %% Could be an innocent mistake the connection lives.
  988:     Pid ! foobar,
  989:     ct:sleep(500),
  990:     {status, _} = process_info(Pid, status),
  991:     process_flag(trap_exit, Flag).
  992: 
  993: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  994: 
  995: clean_shutdown() ->
  996:     [{doc, "Test that owning process that exits with reason "
  997:      "'shutdown' does not cause an error message. OTP 6035"}].
  998: 
  999: clean_shutdown(Config) ->
 1000:     Parent = self(),
 1001:     HelperPid = spawn(
 1002:                   fun() ->
 1003:                           ftp__open(Config, [{verbose,true}]),
 1004:                           Parent ! ok,
 1005:                           receive
 1006:                               nothing -> ok
 1007:                           end
 1008:                   end),
 1009:     receive
 1010:         ok ->
 1011:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1012:             LogFile = filename:join([PrivDir,"ticket_6035.log"]),
 1013:              error_logger:logfile({open, LogFile}),
 1014:             exit(HelperPid, shutdown),
 1015:             timer:sleep(2000),
 1016:             error_logger:logfile(close),
 1017:             case unwanted_error_report(LogFile) of
 1018:                 true ->  {fail, "Bad logfile"};
 1019:                 false -> ok
 1020:             end
 1021:     end.
 1022: 
 1023: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1024: ftp_worker() ->
 1025:     [{doc, "Makes sure the ftp worker processes are added and removed "
 1026:       "appropriately to/from the supervison tree."}].
 1027: ftp_worker(Config) ->
 1028:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp,Config),
 1029:     case supervisor:which_children(ftp_sup) of
 1030:         [{_,_, worker, [ftp]}] ->
 1031:             ftp:close(Pid),
 1032:             ct:sleep(5000),
 1033:             [] = supervisor:which_children(ftp_sup),
 1034:             ok;
 1035:         Children ->
 1036:             ct:fail("Unexpected children: ~p",[Children])
 1037:     end.
 1038: 
 1039: 
 1040: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1041: %%% Error codes not tested elsewhere
 1042: 
 1043: error_elogin(Config0) ->
 1044:     Dir = "test",
 1045:     OldFile = "old.txt",
 1046:     NewFile = "new.txt",
 1047:     SrcDir = "data",
 1048:     File = "file.txt",
 1049:     Config = set_state([reset,
 1050:                         {mkdir,Dir},
 1051:                         {mkfile,OldFile,<<"Contents..">>},
 1052:                         {mkfile,[SrcDir,File],<<"Contents..">>}], Config0),
 1053: 
 1054:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
 1055:     ok = ftp:lcd(Pid, id2ftp(SrcDir,Config)),
 1056:     {error,elogin} = ftp:send(Pid, File),
 1057:     ok = ftp:lcd(Pid, id2ftp("",Config)),
 1058:     {error,elogin} = ftp:pwd(Pid),
 1059:     {error,elogin} = ftp:cd(Pid, id2ftp(Dir,Config)),
 1060:     {error,elogin} = ftp:rename(Pid,
 1061:                                 id2ftp(OldFile,Config),
 1062:                                 id2ftp(NewFile,Config)),
 1063:     ok.
 1064: 
 1065: error_ehost(_Config) ->
 1066:     {error, ehost} = ftp:open("nohost.nodomain"),
 1067:     ok.
 1068: 
 1069: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1070: error_datafail() ->
 1071:     [{doc, "Test that failure to open data channel captures "
 1072:      "error emitted on ctrl channel"}].
 1073: 
 1074: error_datafail(Config) ->
 1075:     Self = self(),
 1076:     Pid = proplists:get_value(ftp, Config),
 1077:     % ftp:latest_ctrl_response/1 returns {error,eclosed}
 1078:     % and erlang:group_leader/2 does not work under ct
 1079:     dbg:start(),
 1080:     dbg:tracer(process, {fun
 1081:         ({trace,P,call,{ftp_internal,verbose,[M,_,'receive']}}, ok) when P == Pid -> Self ! M, ok;
 1082:         (_, ok) -> ok
 1083:     end, ok}),
 1084:     dbg:tpl(ftp_internal, verbose, []),
 1085:     dbg:p(Pid, [call]),
 1086:     {error,_} = ftp:ls(Pid),
 1087:     dbg:stop(),
 1088:     Recv = fun(Recv) ->
 1089:         receive
 1090:             Msg when is_list(Msg) ->
 1091:                 case string:find(Msg, "session reuse required") of
 1092:                     nomatch -> Recv(Recv);
 1093:                     _ -> ok
 1094:                 end
 1095:             after 2000 ->
 1096:                 {fail, "missing error stating 'session reuse required'"}
 1097:         end
 1098:     end,
 1099:     Result = Recv(Recv),
 1100:     Result.
 1101: 
 1102: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1103: %% Internal functions  -----------------------------------------------
 1104: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1105: 
 1106: chk_file(Path=[C|_], ExpectedContents, Config) when 0<C,C=<255 ->
 1107:     chk_file([Path], ExpectedContents, Config);
 1108: 
 1109: chk_file(PathList, ExpectedContents, Config) ->
 1110:     Path = filename:join(PathList),
 1111:     AbsPath = id2abs(Path,Config),
 1112:     case file:read_file(AbsPath) of
 1113:         {ok,ExpectedContents} ->
 1114:             true;
 1115:         {ok,ReadContents} ->
 1116:             {error,{diff,Pos,RC,LC}} = find_diff(ReadContents, ExpectedContents, 1),
 1117:             ct:log("Bad contents of ~p.~nGot:~n~p~nExpected:~n~p~nDiff at pos ~p ~nRead: ~p~nExp : ~p",
 1118:                    [AbsPath,ReadContents,ExpectedContents,Pos,RC,LC]),
 1119:             ct:fail("Bad contents of ~p", [Path]);
 1120:         {error,Error} ->
 1121:             try begin
 1122:                     {ok,CWD} = file:get_cwd(),
 1123:                     ct:log("file:get_cwd()=~p~nfiles:~n~p",[CWD,file:list_dir(CWD)])
 1124:                 end
 1125:             of _ -> ok
 1126:             catch _:_ ->ok
 1127:             end,
 1128:             ct:fail("Error reading ~p: ~p",[Path,Error])
 1129:     end.
 1130: 
 1131: 
 1132: chk_no_file(Path=[C|_], Config) when 0<C,C=<255 ->
 1133:     chk_no_file([Path], Config);
 1134: 
 1135: chk_no_file(PathList, Config) ->
 1136:     Path = filename:join(PathList),
 1137:     AbsPath = id2abs(Path,Config),
 1138:     case file:read_file(AbsPath) of
 1139:         {error,enoent} ->
 1140:             true;
 1141:         {ok,Contents} ->
 1142:             ct:log("File ~p exists although it shouldn't. Contents:~n~p",
 1143:                    [AbsPath,Contents]),
 1144:             ct:fail("File exists: ~p", [Path]);
 1145:         {error,Error} ->
 1146:             ct:fail("Unexpected error reading ~p: ~p",[Path,Error])
 1147:     end.
 1148: 
 1149: 
 1150: chk_dir(Path=[C|_], Config) when 0<C,C=<255 ->
 1151:     chk_dir([Path], Config);
 1152: 
 1153: chk_dir(PathList, Config) ->
 1154:     Path = filename:join(PathList),
 1155:     AbsPath = id2abs(Path,Config),
 1156:     case file:read_file_info(AbsPath) of
 1157:         {ok, #file_info{type=directory}} ->
 1158:             true;
 1159:         {ok, #file_info{type=Type}} ->
 1160:             ct:fail("Expected dir ~p is a ~p",[Path,Type]);
 1161:         {error,Error} ->
 1162:             ct:fail("Expected dir ~p: ~p",[Path,Error])
 1163:     end.
 1164: 
 1165: chk_no_dir(PathList, Config) ->
 1166:     Path = filename:join(PathList),
 1167:     AbsPath = id2abs(Path,Config),
 1168:     case file:read_file_info(AbsPath) of
 1169:         {error,enoent} ->
 1170:             true;
 1171:         {ok, #file_info{type=directory}} ->
 1172:             ct:fail("Dir ~p erroneously exists",[Path]);
 1173:         {ok, #file_info{type=Type}} ->
 1174:             ct:fail("~p ~p erroneously exists",[Type,Path]);
 1175:         {error,Error} ->
 1176:             ct:fail("Unexpected error for ~p: ~p",[Path,Error])
 1177:     end.
 1178: 
 1179: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1180: find_executable(Config) ->
 1181:     search_executable(proplists:get_value(ftpservers, Config, ?default_ftp_servers)).
 1182: 
 1183: 
 1184: search_executable([{Name,Paths,_StartCmd,_ChkUp,_StopCommand,_ConfigUpd,_Host,_Port}|Srvrs]) ->
 1185:     case os_find(Name,Paths) of
 1186:         false ->
 1187:             ct:log("~p not found",[Name]),
 1188:             search_executable(Srvrs);
 1189:         AbsName ->
 1190:             ct:comment("Found ~p",[AbsName]),
 1191:             {ok, {AbsName,_StartCmd,_ChkUp,_StopCommand,_ConfigUpd,_Host,_Port}}
 1192:     end;
 1193: search_executable([]) ->
 1194:     false.
 1195: 
 1196: 
 1197: os_find(Name, Paths) ->
 1198:     case os:find_executable(Name, Paths) of
 1199:         false -> os:find_executable(Name);
 1200:         AbsName -> AbsName
 1201:     end.
 1202: 
 1203: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1204: start_ftpd(Config0) ->
 1205:     {AbsName,StartCmd,_ChkUp,_StopCommand,ConfigRewrite,Host,Port} =
 1206:         proplists:get_value(ftpd_data, Config0),
 1207:     case StartCmd(Config0, AbsName) of
 1208:         {ok,StartResult} ->
 1209:             Config = [{ftpd_host,Host},
 1210:                       {ftpd_port,Port},
 1211:                       {ftpd_start_result,StartResult} | ConfigRewrite(Config0)],
 1212:             Options = case proplists:get_value(ftpd_ssl_implicit, Config) of
 1213:                 true -> [{tls,vsftpd_tls()},{tls_sec_method,ftps}];
 1214:                 _ -> [] % we do not need to test AUTH TLS
 1215:             end,
 1216:             try
 1217:                 ftp__close(ftp__open(Config,[{verbose,true}|Options]))
 1218:             of
 1219:                 Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
 1220:                     ct:log("Usable ftp server ~p started on ~p:~p",[AbsName,Host,Port]),
 1221:                     Config
 1222:             catch
 1223:                 Class:Exception ->
 1224:                     ct:log("Ftp server ~p started on ~p:~p but is unusable:~n~p:~p",
 1225:                            [AbsName,Host,Port,Class,Exception]),
 1226:                     catch stop_ftpd(Config),
 1227:                     {skip, [AbsName," started but unusable"]}
 1228:             end;
 1229:         {error,Msg} ->
 1230:             {skip, [AbsName," not started: ",Msg]}
 1231:     end.
 1232: 
 1233: stop_ftpd(Config) ->
 1234:     {_Name,_StartCmd,_ChkUp,StopCommand,_ConfigUpd,_Host,_Port} = proplists:get_value(ftpd_data, Config),
 1235:     StopCommand(proplists:get_value(ftpd_start_result,Config)).
 1236: 
 1237: ftpd_running(Config) ->
 1238:     {_Name,_StartCmd,ChkUp,_StopCommand,_ConfigUpd,_Host,_Port} = proplists:get_value(ftpd_data, Config),
 1239:     undefined =/= ChkUp(proplists:get_value(ftpd_start_result,Config)).
 1240: 
 1241: ftp__open(Config, Options) ->
 1242:     application:ensure_started(ftp),
 1243:     Host = proplists:get_value(ftpd_host,Config),
 1244:     Port = proplists:get_value(ftpd_port,Config),
 1245:     ct:log("Host=~p, Port=~p",[Host,Port]),
 1246:     {ok,Pid} = ftp:open(Host, [{port,Port} | Options]),
 1247:     [{ftp,Pid}|Config].
 1248: 
 1249: ftp__close(Config) ->
 1250:     ok = ftp:close(proplists:get_value(ftp,Config)),
 1251:     Config.
 1252: 
 1253: ftp_start_service(Config, Options) ->
 1254:     Host = proplists:get_value(ftpd_host,Config),
 1255:     Port = proplists:get_value(ftpd_port,Config),
 1256:     ct:log("Host=~p, Port=~p",[Host,Port]),
 1257:     {ok,Pid} = ftp:open([{host, Host},{port,Port} | Options]),
 1258:     [{ftp,Pid}|Config].
 1259: 
 1260: ftp_stop_service(Config) ->
 1261:     ok = ftp:close(proplists:get_value(ftp,Config)),
 1262:     Config.
 1263: 
 1264: split(Cs) -> string:tokens(Cs, "\r\n").
 1265: 
 1266: find_diff(Bin1, Bin2) ->
 1267:     case find_diff(Bin1, Bin2, 1) of
 1268:         {error, {diff,Pos,RC,LC}} ->
 1269:             ct:log("Contents differ at position ~p.~nOp1: ~p~nOp2: ~p",[Pos,RC,LC]),
 1270:             ct:fail("Contents differ at pos ~p",[Pos]);
 1271:         Other ->
 1272:             Other
 1273:     end.
 1274: 
 1275: find_diff(A, A, _) -> true;
 1276: find_diff(<<H,T1/binary>>, <<H,T2/binary>>, Pos) -> find_diff(T1, T2, Pos+1);
 1277: find_diff(RC, LC, Pos) -> {error, {diff, Pos, RC, LC}}.
 1278: 
 1279: set_state(Ops, Config) when is_list(Ops) -> lists:foldl(fun set_state/2, Config, Ops);
 1280: 
 1281: set_state(reset, Config) ->
 1282:     rm('*', id2abs("",Config)),
 1283:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1284:     file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
 1285:     ftp:lcd(proplists:get_value(ftp,Config),PrivDir),
 1286:     set_state({mkdir,""},Config);
 1287: set_state({mkdir,Id}, Config) ->
 1288:     Abs = id2abs(Id, Config),
 1289:     mk_path(Abs),
 1290:     file:make_dir(Abs),
 1291:     Config;
 1292: set_state({mkfile,Id,Contents}, Config) ->
 1293:     Abs = id2abs(Id, Config),
 1294:     mk_path(Abs),
 1295:     ok = file:write_file(Abs, Contents),
 1296:     Config.
 1297: 
 1298: mk_path(Abs) -> lists:foldl(fun mk_path/2, [], filename:split(filename:dirname(Abs))).
 1299: 
 1300: mk_path(F, Pfx) ->
 1301:     case file:read_file_info(AbsName=filename:join(Pfx,F)) of
 1302:         {ok,#file_info{type=directory}} ->
 1303:             AbsName;
 1304:         {error,eexist} ->
 1305:             AbsName;
 1306:         {error,enoent} ->
 1307:             ok = file:make_dir(AbsName),
 1308:             AbsName
 1309:     end.
 1310: 
 1311: rm('*', Pfx) ->
 1312:     {ok,Fs} = file:list_dir(Pfx),
 1313:     lists:foreach(fun(F) -> rm(F, Pfx) end, Fs);
 1314: rm(F, Pfx) ->
 1315:     case file:read_file_info(AbsName=filename:join(Pfx,F)) of
 1316:         {ok,#file_info{type=directory}} ->
 1317:             {ok,Fs} = file:list_dir(AbsName),
 1318:             lists:foreach(fun(F1) -> rm(F1,AbsName) end, Fs),
 1319:             ok = file:del_dir(AbsName);
 1320: 
 1321:         {ok,#file_info{type=regular}} ->
 1322:             ok = file:delete(AbsName);
 1323: 
 1324:         {error,enoent} ->
 1325:             ok
 1326:     end.
 1327: 
 1328: id2abs(Id, Conf) -> filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Conf),ids(Id)).
 1329: id2ftp(Id, Conf) -> (proplists:get_value(id2ftp,Conf))(ids(Id)).
 1330: id2ftp_result(Id, Conf) -> (proplists:get_value(id2ftp_result,Conf))(ids(Id)).
 1331: 
 1332: ids([[_|_]|_]=Ids) -> filename:join(Ids);
 1333: ids(Id) -> Id.
 1334: 
 1335: 
 1336: is_expected_absName(Id, File, Conf) -> File = (proplists:get_value(id2abs,Conf))(Id).
 1337: is_expected_ftpInName(Id, File, Conf) -> File = (proplists:get_value(id2ftp,Conf))(Id).
 1338: is_expected_ftpOutName(Id, File, Conf) -> File = (proplists:get_value(id2ftp_result,Conf))(Id).
 1339: 
 1340: 
 1341: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1342: %%% Help functions for the option '{progress,Progress}'
 1343: %%%
 1344: 
 1345: %%%----------------
 1346: %%% Callback:
 1347: 
 1348: progress(#progress{} = P, _File, {file_size, Total} = M) ->
 1349:     ct:pal("Progress: ~p",[M]),
 1350:     progress_report_receiver ! start,
 1351:     P#progress{total = Total};
 1352: 
 1353: progress(#progress{current = Current} = P, _File, {transfer_size, 0} = M) ->
 1354:     ct:pal("Progress: ~p",[M]),
 1355:     progress_report_receiver ! finish,
 1356:     case P#progress.total of
 1357:         unknown -> P;
 1358:         Current -> P;
 1359:         Total   -> ct:fail({error, {progress, {total,Total}, {current,Current}}}),
 1360:                    P
 1361:     end;
 1362: 
 1363: progress(#progress{current = Current} = P, _File, {transfer_size, Size} = M) ->
 1364:     ct:pal("Progress: ~p",[M]),
 1365:     progress_report_receiver ! update,
 1366:     P#progress{current = Current + Size};
 1367: 
 1368: progress(P, _File, M) ->
 1369:     ct:pal("Progress **** Strange: ~p",[M]),
 1370:     P.
 1371: 
 1372: 
 1373: %%%----------------
 1374: %%% Help process that counts the files transferred:
 1375: 
 1376: progress_report_receiver_init(Parent, N) ->
 1377:     register(progress_report_receiver, self()),
 1378:     progress_report_receiver_expect_N_files(Parent, N).
 1379: 
 1380: progress_report_receiver_expect_N_files(_Parent, 0) ->
 1381:     ct:pal("progress_report got all files!", []);
 1382: progress_report_receiver_expect_N_files(Parent, N) ->
 1383:     ct:pal("progress_report expects ~p more files",[N]),
 1384:     receive
 1385:         start -> ok
 1386:     end,
 1387:     progress_report_receiver_loop(Parent, N-1).
 1388: 
 1389: 
 1390: progress_report_receiver_loop(Parent, N) ->
 1391:     ct:pal("progress_report expect update | finish. N = ~p",[N]),
 1392:     receive
 1393:         update ->
 1394:             ct:pal("progress_report got update",[]),
 1395:             progress_report_receiver_loop(Parent, N);
 1396:         finish  ->
 1397:             ct:pal("progress_report got finish, send ~p to ~p",[{self(),ok}, Parent]),
 1398:             Parent ! {self(), ok},
 1399:             progress_report_receiver_expect_N_files(Parent, N)
 1400:     end.
 1401: 
 1402: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1403: %%% Help functions for bug OTP-6035
 1404: 
 1405: unwanted_error_report(LogFile) ->
 1406:     case file:read_file(LogFile) of
 1407:         {ok, Bin} ->
 1408:             nomatch =/= binary:match(Bin, <<"=ERROR REPORT====">>);
 1409:         _ ->
 1410:             ct:fail({no_logfile, LogFile})
 1411:     end.
 1412:
